column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am a 45yo female who suffers from 8-10 pain disorders, I AM SO SICK OF EVERY DOCTOR I SEE, THINKING I WANT A QUICK FIX TO GET HIGH. That is not the case, I suffer from CHRONIC PAIN & I HAVE BEEN A POSTER PERSON AT MY PHARMACY .Then I was referred to my pain management specialist.I love how he treats me(he don't want to adjust my meds) right now tho.I'm like most patients with CHRONIC PAIN, I have tried them all,& I have received the best results from Opana er. it has brought some quality of life  back to me. I still feel like I need a med re-evaluation. I wish I could take the opanaIR for break through pain instead of percocet 10mg.I think that the different combinations is what causes the side effects.I am lucky I am on disability and have been for 17 years.So I have Medicare &Medicaid,& I only have a small co-payment for Medicare part D.(prescription coverage). FOR ANYONE THAT DOES NOT HAVE PRESCRIPTION COVERAGE THIS MIGHT HELP YOU GET YOUR MEDICATION. FIND OUT WHICH  COMPANY MAKES YOUR MEDICATION, CALL THEM AND ASK IF THEY HAVE AN INDIGENT CARE PROGRAM,That's a program for people that don't have any insurance or they have insurance but it doesn't cover YOUR medication. Or you can look it up on the internet, I just did a search for assistance for low-income families. That's where I found that information! Good Luck to you all,& "GOD BLESS" may our lives be as pain free as possible, and our bodies strong enough to handle it,our minds able to process a pain free BODY,MIND,SOUL,SPIRIT & LIFE STYLE CHANGE TO MANAGE & COPE WITH OUR NEW FOUND FRIEND OPANA ER! HOWEVER I HATE THE NEW FORMULATION, I'M TAKING OPANA ER 30 mg. ER STANDS FOR EXTENDED RELEASE! WITH THE NEW FORMULATION IT'S LIKE DELAYED EXTENDED RELEASE.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Opana around July of 2010. In Feb. 2010 one day I had a cyatic nerve & my body has gone down hill since then.  I have chronic daily pain in my right hip, pelvis & greater trochanter (that's the side of the hip). They tried all of the "easy" pain meds from Feb - July (Oxycontin/Oxycodene - the same drug, different manufactures ; Vicoden ; etc.) they decided on the Opana, and it's been a Godsend.  I have a job where I sit down 8 -10 hours a day, so my pain has became worse, so my Dr. has added Opana ER & I've been taking it at 6AM & 6PM (Thanks to an alarm on my cell phone) & it's been working well.  I would not be walking if it wasn't for Opana & Opana ER.  I take these meds AS described. I live in chronic pain, I'm not looking for a "high" & I don't take more than prescribed or any earlier than prescribed. And, yet the Opana ER IS daily, I (and you) must remember that the prescription for the Opana says "AS NEEDED".  If you take it as it's prescribed, it will work wonders.

column2: chagua, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
GinaAngel56, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Opana ER 40mg/every 12 hours & Opana oral for break through pain. I am NEVER out of pain! Prior to this I took Roxicodone. Then I had microdiscectomy & IDET done on L4/L5 & L5/S1 & ended up in severe/completely debilitating pain a week & 1/2 later & in the hospital for 2 wks. There, I was on Dilaudid IV and Fentanyl 100mg patch.  I was switched from the IV Dilaudid to Opana when I came home and kept the 100mg Fenanyl patch, still in a lot of pain.  A week & 1/2 later the dr added Opana ER & had me stop the patch due to no relief of pain. The side effects on Opana are HORRIBLE!!! Severe constipation, spontaneous sweating, groggy, insomnia, stomach bloated, 20lb weight gain, constant mild headache & unable to focus.  Even if Opana worked for my pain, which it does NOT ~ the side effects are not worth it.  My pain is still at a 3 when laying down and it shoots to a 9 when I stand up from sitting, when I walk, etc.  I see a surgeon on 11/15/10 regarding disc bulge & spinal stenosis at L1/L2.  In the meantime, I have a call into my pain management dr. I have decreased the use of Opana IR & increased my Senekot and actually had a bm today!  I had to PUSH really hard, but at least I got something more than little marble sized pieces. I look forward to my dr's call & stopping Opana completely!  I would not recommend this medication to anyone!  DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICATION!

subsailorslady1980, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on 50mcg Fentanyl patches for a while now, but was having breakthrough pain that the 5/500mg Vicodin just wasn't helping at all. I was havingn to go to the ER twice a month or more for a 2mg shot of dilaudid to bring pain levels back down. My pain management doctor started me on 10mg Opana and it so far seems to do the trick for the breakthrough pain. I have Occipital Nueralgia and Severe Right Sciatic Nueropathy. I have had Many injections and ablations to prevent nerves from transmitting pain. That seemed to work on some nerves but not all of them. It costs 20,000 dollars per procedure and insurance doesn't like that to much. This medication seems to work much better then Vicodin and I don't have to go to the ER. I have been on all kinds of meds including Roxicodone, Percocet, Lorcet and so on...and have several allergies to NSAIDS and Demerol and even the new drug Nucynta. Opana hasn't given me any side effects at all so far. I like this medication much better than any other ones I have tried because it doesn't make me feel foggy or out of it. I can actually function on it and with children that range from 13 years old to 14 months functioning is extremely important! Good luck to all of you looking for something that works for you. Medications work differently for everyone so it is all trial and error to see what works best for you.

column2: stokem102, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have chronic pain in my lower back caused by a hirneated disk, pinched nerve and some other problems. I also suffer from pain in my left leg and foot due to a fracture that didn't heal right. I have had about 30 steroid shots so far in my lower back to relieve the pain and several in my left foot to ease the pain with no lasting pain relief. I have been on quite a few different pain medications, most with awful side effects. I am currently with the 5th pain doctor. I have been referred from 1 doctor to another when I wasn't getting any pain relief from what they were prescribing, pain meds, and different physical therapy. I am not looking for a high and I am not trying to get pain meds that have the "high effect", I just want some relief from the pain. I was on opana 5 mg. 4x a day for a month with very little relief. This is my 2nd month on it but my doctor increased to 10 mg. 4x a day accompanied with 6 non-steroidal shots in the ligaments on both sides of my spine. The shot worked for 4 days and after taking opana 10 mg. I started having some of the side effects that others have experienced. I wasn't sure they were related to the opana until I read the reviews here on WebMd. I am sick to my stomach, jittery, loss of appetite (I have needed to lose weight but not this way), restless at night, sleepy during the day,funny taste of sodium all the time, and I am still in pain, but less severe. I'm not sure if the relief outweighs the side effects. I'm going to keep using it throughout the rest of the month and hope that the side effects ease up and the pain is brought down to a liveable level.

Spodee, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have osteo-necrosis (or Avascular-necrosis; AVN for short) My bones are not getting blood to the marrow so they are dying from the inside out.  A total hip replacement would solve the problem but my age(30) disqualifies me as a candidate for the surgery.(So my local doctors tell me).  I was in a car crash about 8 years ago and had issues with my c-spine. The spine specialist gave me spinal injections of cortisone which contained steroids and those steroids caused my condition.  About 5 years ago I got my AVN diagnosis.  I am now seeing a very caring pain specialist who had the pain pump installed.  The meds in that are very strong but since my problem is in my hips and I can still walk I have lots of breakthrough pain.  This medication(Opana ER 10MG) is replacing my MS Contin 60MG.  It is working so far.  For those with severely debilitating pain I highly recommend the pain pump.  2 Biggest down sides to the pump are ER's are afraid to mess with you & if MRI's are extremely necessary to your health then I don't recommend the pump.

column2: rsdbarbie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Opana comes in two forms the long acting and the short acting for breakthrough  pain. Both drugs should be reviewed seperate. As with any major change in pain I medications I did have some severe withdrawl issues. This drug is at 50% of oxy and to do it right you need to go in at even a lower dose them make 10mg adjustments. I went from 240 oxy a day to 80mg opana a day and had severe spasms in my intestines sick to my stomach and could not eat. After i got it built back up to 120 mg of opana( the equivalant) of oxy it all went away. So sometimes I think the reported side effects of this drug the first few weeks is more the side effects of cooming off the current medications and making the switch to Opana. I am not sure yet if it is better than oxy was for my pain control for full body rsd but I am going to give it 4 to 6 weeks of a constant dose before i decide.

column2: stricklypresh, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using Opana 20mg twice a day and 10 mg 3-4 times a day as needed for break though pain.  I was placed on it last month after having been on fentanyl finally at end of 3 yrs on it with a 125 mcg patch chged every 48 hrs and 800 mcg lollipops used as needed for break through pain - I had an allergic reaction to it and had to be changed.  I went from that to 40mg oxycontin twice daily and 20 mcg oxycodone 3 times a day.  Worked well for 7 mos, then I had an allergic reaction to those and thus Opana.  Onl difficulties so far are some constipation and a lot of sleep, both I figure will pass with adjustment.  My pain is so severe from head to foot and so different for each area.  I neurothapy in both hands and feet.  They burn like as if I was in self combustion yet the surfaces are numb.  I've had carpal-tunnel surgery on both hands.  I have degenerative arthritis that has destroyed the facets in the small of my back leaving nerves exposed and severely damaged with damage continuing. I have 3 bulging discs in the cervical area with damaged facets also. T5 is damaged from the arthritis all of which cause great pain down my arms and across my shoulders and have absolutely throbbing shoulder blades. I fell in the shower in 2005 causing 2 compression fractures to L5 which have increased to 4 fractures due to arthritis plus 2 bulging discs at L4 and L3. S1-S3 have facet problems.  I also have fibromyalgia. I have had thermoplasty on L5. Radio Frequency  both left and right L5-S15 times just this last year and Epidurals - all to no avail.  Had RF 2 yrs ago that lasted 2.5 mos for which I still thank God for the relief.  No pain meds stop my pain and I cannot stand or walk without my walker with chair in it.  But I am so very thankful for all of the meds that have been available to help ease my pain.  I just pray I do not become allergic to Opana, also.  Pray for me/

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 54 yo female (young, no serious health problems, working & thriving 'til a car accident hurt my back [L4&5] severely.  That's all long lasting. I used Opana rx for the last 4 months & it helped the pain but the side effects made me too ill. Now I prefer the pain.  Read some of what happened to me in the last 2 months. Symps/moderate to severe: bowels, continuous urinary tract infections w/either no stoppage of emptying bladder or blockage, balance issues, nausea, panic attacks & anxiety, breathing problems, high blood pessure, dry mouth, sweating, blurred vision, trouble sleeping & loss of appetite. You ask why did I suffer so long? Well, becuz my current pain mgmt doctor refused to take me off. His answer to all this: (1) see a urologist (never been to one in my life) AND (2) I'm "allergic to my husband" & "he needs to be on antibiotics at the same time" as I am. That was just two days ago. I called my pharmacist today and she told me to stop IMMEDIATELY & I feel better already! If he sees me again it will be a picture. TAKE THIS MEDICINE IN THE CARE OF A DOCTOR THAT YOU TRUST WHO WILL MONITOR YOU CLOSELY. THE ONE I HAD CAME WITH GREAT RECOMMENDATIONS FROM MY BACK SPECIALIST. HE WAS NOT COMPETENT & I'M GOING TO REPORT HIM! THANK YOU WEBMD FOR YOUR INFO!

column9: i have been in chronic pain due to numeruos surgical procedures on my spine....too many to list, and also have a stimulator implant, have been on every drug out there and been off them too for about 4 months have been toughing it out just to give my body a break, well went to a pain clinic 2 days ago for releif, the pain had gone through the roof. against my wishes i was put on opana ir 5mg 4 times day....wow what a releif!!!! it worked immediatly and will be getting it adjusted as needed also will be put on opana er next week..my only gripe is the cost...ugh...my rx ins is through medicare part d and the drug is not covered, anyone have any ideas to help me with that problem would surely appreciate it...i do think after reading numerous reviews that some are seeking that opiate high...sorry...as for me releif spells life.

column9: i have had lower back pain for 5 years now. i have been on various pain meds and the opana ir is by far the best yet. i guess that it works different for everyone but it makes my pain dramatically decrease without the drowsy drained side effects.

column9: This is the very first time I have ever taken a medication that took away my pain!!!!!I have suffered for more than 15 years with severe back and neck pain. column2: GRATEFUL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I HAVE CHRONIC PAIN IN ALOT OF AREAS IN MY BODY,I HAVE ALWAYS HAD ALOT OF PAIN IN MY LEGS DUE TO PERIPHEAL NERVE DAMAGE SINCE CHILDHOOD,AND AS I BECAME OLDER MOST ALL OF THE WORK I'VE DONE WAS PHYSICAL LABOR,AND THAT WORE MY BODY OUT SOONER,I'VE ENJOINED THAT KIND OF WORK,BECAUSE I WAS VERY HYPER ALSO,I;VE HAD ALOT OF ENJURIES DUE TO THAT,AND SEVERAL MOTOR VEHICHAL INJURIES,SUCH AS WHIPLASH AND BACK INJURIES,AND I HAVE FIBROMYALGIA,AND NERVE PAIN IN MY LEGS AND FEET,2 ROTATOR CUFF SURGERIES,SUCH AS CERVICAL FUSION iN MY NECK , I ALSO SUFFER FROM BACK INGURIES,ALSO I HAVE OSTEOARTHRITS,ECT.SO YOU CAN IMAGINE HOW MUCH PAIN I INDURE MOST EVERYDAY OF MY LIFE,SO THIS IS WHY NEED STRONG PAIN MEICATION.IT'S HARD FOR ME TO LIVE A NORMAL LIFE FROM ONE DAY TO THE NEXT.THERE ARE OTHER PAINS THAT I HAVE TO LIVE WITH,TOO MANY TO MENTION,SO THIS PAIN MEDICATION IS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT PART OF MY LIFE,JUST TO LIVE A DAY WITHOUT PAIN,OR I SHOULD SAY I'M VERY,GRATEFUL TO WHOM EVER MADE THIS NEW PAIN MEDICATION,SO THANKS SO MUCH ECT.SINCERELY,KATHY DUNLAP.

column2: counselorhoward, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had 4 herniated Disc's  & use MS-Contin for a long acting Opiate && I have used Dilaudid 8 mgs that givesme nausea, However I found that 10mg-30 mgs IR. Opana to be superior to either IR.Opana has been around for 20 years as firstNumorphin or Oxymorphone. I just startedusing it, & aside for minor side effectsit works when I am in Severe Pain. Peoplewho are in serious pain are not interestedin the High, but the Relief the drug gives.I agree, if its not working for you, your not taking enough. I Am a Therapist & knowthere are no perfect drugs, but how we respond to them & the effort we make tounderstand our Pain.

column2: boss302kirk, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: kudos to jitterbug for hanging in there, rolling with the side effects that everyone goes through while asssessing a new med, and finding positive relief through blind faith! You are the first patient,other than myself, that found excellent pain control other than looking for a "high!" I only hope that others in our situation take heed and follow through with a positive attitude to control pain! CONGRATULATIONS! Sincerely, boss302kirk@yahoo.com.

column2: jitterbug, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had trouble tolerating OpanaER and IR at first. After I had been on it about 2 weeks, the side effects went away. Then I realized how well it was managing my pain. The only thing I have had to work with is making sure I take it at specific times or I will start having withdraw symptoms. I can tell if I miss my scheduled dose by one to two hours. But, it works better than anything else I've taken (methadone, oxycontin, dilaudid and several others).I was in a car accident when I was 21yrs old. It ruptured a disc in my neck (between C5 and C6),so it had to be removed. It has been 23yrs ago and now I have two more discs that are bulging along with facet joint problems. This medicine has allowed me to do so much more with my family without being miserable. I HIGHLY recommend OpanaER and IR for breakthrough pain.

column2: foxy35, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: opana was not a long lasting pain reducer and did not bring pain level down that much I had a fushion of C1&C2 ll

column2: boss302kirk, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have chronic severe pain due to pancreatitis,osteoporosis,osteoarthritis, and a host of other bummers that I don,t care to get into. My input will not be well-liked by most patients. From what I've read with exception of the rare kidney disorder, these so-called patients are looking for a "high". I have spent 35 years dealing with pancreatitis{chronic-relapsing} to be exact. Also known as "auto-digestion" for those of you not in the business of pain control. I'm 51 yrs. old and if, I say if, I get high on my meds...boy to have that old feeling back. But it's not going to happen. Pain control is all I have. My method of using opana works for me. People, I've tried thm all in my search for the pain-free day, and opana gives me a leg up on it. My response to the gentleman who likes 8mg dilaudid, he's looking for a quick high,being dilaudid is an immediate release drug. 10mg of IR opana would make 8mg of dilaudid seem just ok. I was on exactly that before opana. Opana wins,hands down in the pain control area. Try living in the pain control world, instead of the "get high" world. Your life would be better. I wish you all well and God Bless.
